quotes.quote: You are brighter than the sunlight and bolder than a rainbow. You are the reason spring was created in the first place.
Go on a nature walk with your camera.
Of all the paths you take in life, make sure a few of them are dirt.
quotes.author: John Muir

quotes.quote: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Spending time outdoors in nature will improve your ability to reach an inner tranquility.
You can never conquer the mountain. You can only conquer yourself.
quotes.author: Jim Whittaker

quotes.quote: Everything that slows us down and forces patience, everything that sets us back into the slow circles of nature, is a help.
quotes.author: May Sarton

quotes.quote: Every blade in the field - Every leaf in the forest - lays down its life in its season as beautifully as it was taken up.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: The troubles of modern life come from being divorced from nature.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: Sunsets connect us to our sense of wonder.
Drive nature out of the door and it will fly in at the window.
quotes.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quotes.quote: Those who contemplate the beauty of the earth find reserves of strength that will endure as long as life lasts.
quotes.author: Rachel Carson

quotes.quote: The Sun is never alone as the light remains with him always. Even when he goes down sinking...sinking, the light drowns with him.
It's not the mountain we conquer, but ourselves.
quotes.author: Sir Edmund Hillary

quotes.quote: We are now in the mountains and they are in us, kindling enthusiasm, making every nerve quiver, filling every pore and cell of us.
quotes.author: John Muir

quotes.quote: Nature, to be commanded, must be obeyed. The imagination must be given not wings but weights.
quotes.author: Henry Adams

quotes.quote: Only mountains can feel the frozen warmth of the sun through snow's gentle caress on their peaks.
Spring is painted in daffodil yellows, robin egg blues, new grass green and the brightness of hope for a better life.
Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: It was a morning like other mornings and yet perfect among mornings.
quotes.author: John Steinbeck

quotes.quote: With freedom, books, flowers, and the moon, who could not be happy?
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Watching a sunset is an invitation to daydream.
If people in general could be got into the woods, even for once, to hear the trees speak for themselves, all difficulties in the way of forest preservation would vanish.
quotes.author: John Muir

quotes.quote: Whenever you can, spend time in nature. Feel the sun in your face and the breeze in your hair. Smile and thank the Universe for such a perfect moment.
Heaven is under our feet as well as over our heads.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: The visible world is a daily miracle, for those who have eyes and ears.
quotes.author: Edith Wharton

quotes.quote: Going to the woods is going home.
quotes.author: John Muir

quotes.quote: Dark spruce frowned on either side of the frozen waterway.
quotes.author: Jack London
